The **wand of cold** is a [wand](/wiki/Wand "Wand") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Effects](#Effects)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Message](#Message)

- [6 Variants](#Variants)

  - [6.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [6.2 FIQHack](#FIQHack)
  - [6.3 NetHack Fourk](#NetHack_Fourk)

- [7 References](#References)

## Generation

A [Wizard](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard") may receive a wand of cold as part of their starting inventory.

There is a 4% chance that a [randomly-generated wand](/wiki/Wand#Generation "Wand") within the dungeon and its branches will be a wand of cold. Monsters may generate with the wand as a random [offensive item](/wiki/Offensive_item "Offensive item").

[Asmodeus](/wiki/Asmodeus "Asmodeus") [will always generate with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") a wand of cold and a [wand of fire](/wiki/Wand_of_fire "Wand of fire").[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

## Effects

[Zapping](/wiki/Zap "Zap") the wand in a given direction emits a [ray](/wiki/Ray "Ray") of ice that deals 6d6 damage to non-[cold resistant](/wiki/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance") targets, with a +6d3 bonus if the monster has [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance").[\[3\]](#cite_note-3) Monsters hit with this ray have a 1⁄3 chance of any [potions](/wiki/Potion "Potion") in their inventory freezing and shattering. The ray bounces when it hits walls or targets with [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection"); it will also freeze any [moat](/wiki/Moat "Moat") of water it travels over into [ice](/wiki/Ice "Ice"), and [lava](/wiki/Lava "Lava") is cooled and solidified into normal rock.

[Engraving](/wiki/Engraving "Engraving") with a wand of cold will cause a few ice cubes to drop from the wand; this message is unique to the wand, but does not [auto-identify](/wiki/Auto-identify "Auto-identify") it. Doing so over a burned engraving will make it vanish.

[Applying](/wiki/Apply "Apply") a wand of cold to break it will create a damaging magical explosion of cold in a 3×3 square centered on you. See [breaking wands](/wiki/Breaking_wands "Breaking wands") for details.

## Strategy

- *See also: [Wand strategy](/wiki/Wand_strategy "Wand strategy")*

The wand of cold is a useful offensive item against most monsters that can prove just as deadly to you, especially early on where you typically lack a source of [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection") or cold resistance. It can be especially deadly against vulnerable monsters if you have a means of rebounding or reflecting the ray back at them.

In scenarios where a player lacks a [levitation](/wiki/Levitation "Levitation") source or [water walking boots](/wiki/Water_walking_boots "Water walking boots"), a wand of cold with sufficient charges can be a good choice if you need to cross water (e.g., gaining entrance to the [Castle](/wiki/Castle "Castle"), entering the throne room in [Fort Ludios](/wiki/Fort_Ludios "Fort Ludios")) or lava (e.g., the lower floors of the [Valkyrie quest](/wiki/Valkyrie_quest "Valkyrie quest")). Ice can prove slippery to many characters and may potentially melt away, raising the possibility of being stranded - additionally, be careful of monsters with [fire](/wiki/Fire "Fire") attacks! When crossing water or lava using this wand, try to make the shortest ice bridges possible in order to conserve charges.

In the event of much larger crossings, such as [Medusa's Island](/wiki/Medusa%27s_Island "Medusa's Island") in most cases, zapping a [wand of digging](/wiki/Wand_of_digging "Wand of digging") downward is usually a better idea. You might even choose to continue to the Castle, collect its loot and the [wand of wishing](/wiki/Wand_of_wishing "Wand of wishing"), and come back up through Medusa's downstair with better equipment;[\[4\]](#cite_note-4) very rarely, you may want to head even further down to [Vlad's Tower](/wiki/Vlad%27s_Tower "Vlad's Tower") for the guaranteed water walking boots.

A wand of cold can be used to destroy the [door](/wiki/Door "Door") to the [Sokoban](/wiki/Sokoban "Sokoban") zoo without waking up *all* of its inhabitants. The wand can also serve as a valuable offensive/escape item against [sea monsters](/wiki/Sea_monster "Sea monster") such as [giant](/wiki/Giant_eel "Giant eel") and [electric eels](/wiki/Electric_eels "Electric eels") while crossing water: freezing the water they're in will strand them on the surface, weakening them - and in the eels' cases, rendering them unable to [drown](/wiki/Drown "Drown") you - until they re-enter water. Additionally, wand of cold can also be used to retrieve any of the [invocation items](/wiki/Invocation_item "Invocation item") from moats of water or [lava](/wiki/Lava "Lava") by freezing it - the invocation item will then appear on top.

## History

The wand of cold has been present in the game since Hack 1.21, a variant of [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack").

## Message

- A few ice cubes drop from the wand.

  You engraved something on the floor with a wand of cold.

## Variants

In many variants, engraving with the wand of cold will auto-identify it.

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [Ice Mages](/wiki/Ice_Mage "Ice Mage") start the game with a wand of cold.

### FIQHack

In [FIQHack](/wiki/FIQHack "FIQHack"), which incorporates the [Wands Balance Patch](/wiki/Wands_Balance_Patch "Wands Balance Patch"), unskilled usage of a wand of cold chooses the lesser of two values to deal as damage: 3d6 or 40% max HP damage.

### NetHack Fourk

In [NetHack Fourk](/wiki/NetHack_Fourk "NetHack Fourk"), which incorporates the [Wands Balance Patch](/wiki/Wands_Balance_Patch "Wands Balance Patch"), unskilled usage of a wand of cold also chooses the lesser of two values to deal as damage: 3d6 or 40% max HP damage.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [makemon.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 643](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/makemon.c#line643 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/makemon.c")
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.6, line 772](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.6_Released/src/makemon.c#L772)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/zap.c in NetHack 3.6.6, line 3649](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.6_Released/src/zap.c#L3649)
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [A ttyrec about the Castle drawbridge](http://groups.google.com/group/rec.games.roguelike.nethack/browse_frm/thread/5249395885b1cbbe) by [Eidolos](/wiki/User:Eidolos "User:Eidolos")
